Reviews.Title: “A charitable description would be "tired"”
Reviews.Author: Derek_Law
Reviews.Content: The pluses are that the staff are really friendly and helpful and it's in a great central location. Hotel itself could best be described as adequate. It's the right side of seedy but is definitely "tired" and badly in need of investment. So it's ok - but I'll try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff. Deserve a pat on the back.”
Reviews.Author: Spooky388
Reviews.Content: Having been let down by a bed and breakfast on a busy Friday night in Rome, we managed to find the Hotel Assisi. They found us 5 rooms for our group of 13 but could only fit us in for one night. The staff at the front desk then phoned around on our behalf overnight to locate us somewhere else to stay for the other 2 nights. Really above and beyond expected levels of service. As for the hotel, it is conveniently situated close to the railway, rooms were clean and tidy, breakfast compared to others we have experienced in Rome was pretty good and varied.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Rome close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Elefant350
Reviews.Content: Booked via Late Rooms and managed to get a 3rd night free for the price of 2. Hotel is located within a few minutes walk of the central station, which is ideal for dropping bags off and exploring the city. 15 mins walk from the Coleseum and the main centre including the Trevi fountain. Room though not large, more than adequate for one's needs for a few nights. Rome Hotel rooms are not usually large and don't offer good views so don't expect this here but the room was clean and tidy, warm (good for Feb) and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, also very helpful with information. Brekfast was your usual standard Italian fare, with fresh coffee, toast and cakes. Very happy with my pick of Hotel for my short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: xhasox
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a budget hotel near Termini train station as we were only visiting Rome for one day and were to catch a early train to Civitavecchia the next day for a cruise. If going to Rome again we will definitley choose this hotel and I have already recommended it to some friends. Do not expect a 5* hotel, but do expect a good nights sleep in a clean bed, a nice shower and a breakfast that will keep you going until lunch. We chose the hotel after reading the reviews here on TA. We were not disappointed! Very good value for our money. The hotel was clean, the staff were VERY helpful and kind. The breakfast did indeed have many sweet things to offer as another rewiever here said, but you dont HAVE to choose them. There were also some healthier alternatives. When I asked for coffee the man behind the counter offered me a cappuccino which he made for me. That was a bonus I did not expect. In other hotels I usually have to pay extra for "special" coffees Room The bathroom was over expectation for a Italian budget hotel. Clean and no mould and good ventilation, no plumbing issues and some amenities like shower cap, hair conditioner etc. The bed was a little bit hard though. The airconditioning made the room wonderfully cold rather fast. Our room was facing the street, but we were not at all disturbed by any noise from the street. We ate our evening dinner on a cozy trattoria next to the hotel (not the closest one of the two) and we were happy with our pizzas, nothing more nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but poor room standard”
Reviews.Author: GiannaSweden
Reviews.Content: Ok, it's close to Termini but there must be better options. The hotel is very worn down. The window in our room didn't close well so there were lots of noice from the street below. Breakfast was traditional italian with lots of sweet stuff. The staff is really nice but unfortunately it didn't make up for the other things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lensaffair
Reviews.Content: This was a great small hotel close to Roma Termini. Easy to find. Our room was QUIET and we slept great, shower wonderful - yeah the room wasn't huge but hey thats europe hotels. You can walk from here to anywhere if you like walking - we did. Breakfast ok, bit processed for us but we are fussy with organics etc but great coffee made to order. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: DCahalane
Reviews.Content: We choose the Assisi Hotel as it promised we could have twin bedrooms. This was necessary as there were 4 of us travelling. The twin bedrooms turned out to be tiny rooms with two single beds pushed up against each other. The rooms themselves were small but the ensuite shower rooms were minute. In Room 424 the toilet faces the shower and is so close that whilst sitting on it your feet are in the shower tray. Neither comfortable or hygeinic. We would also question the cleanliness. Overall it looks quite clean and neat however their were hairs found in both showers and en suites. A further problem was he so called towels. These turned out to be sheets of a waffled cotton!! Staff were reasonably helpful and a breakfast was provided.

Reviews.Title: “a good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: arrowebrook
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value for money spent,close to termini station and within 15 mins.walking to most historical sites.Restaraunts in abundance locally and at very reasonable cost.Hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful with an adequate sellection for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Rome visited 1st october 2011 5 chicks from Glasgow Scotland”
Reviews.Author: sandra t
Reviews.Content: this hotel is excellent value, staff are very, and hotel very clean, reasonable size bedrooms, and the breakfast was very good, excellent location also next to all amenities, I would defo reccomend this hotel to anyone who would like to visit Rome, mt second time to Rome and "ROMA ROCKS"

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wfmf
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay for 4 nights - somewhere close to the Termini train station as we came and would leave by train - and use of the metro as required. It also had to be competitive in price - this hotel fitted that profile. The staff were always pleasant & helpful. The room was quite large - but had the smallest bathroom i have ever been in - for example you can place your back on to the wall - reach out your arm & touch the other wall ....it was that small. However it was long enough to include al the basics, toilet, sink, shower, bidet etc. The towels although replaced daily were more like cloths - but hey it was all good !! The room had a safe[ free of charge] for valuables, very good air conditioning and a ceiling fan. Good TV with a range of programmes [ mostly Italian - with CNN for English users] - but you dont go to Rome to sit in your hotel all day !!! The room was good and had little traffic noise from outside - where ther are quite a few bars / & places to eat. The breakfast was adaquate rather than comprehensive - but it was more than sufficent to "stoke up the belly " for a day's sight seeing etc. All in all a good basic quality hotel which suited our needs totally for our stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “We can only recommend”
Reviews.Author: hocsike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is only few minutes from the Termini Station, and 200 meters from the shuttle bus station. The hotel is simple tourist hotel, and we need this after the busy day. The room was a comfortable, and clean. The staff was a kind, and helpful. The breakfast was a typical Italian: mostly sweet. Pleasant surprise was, like that the staff waited for me. Certainly we return.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a city-trip to Rom!”
Reviews.Author: Carina M
Reviews.Content: Great location near Termini Station; friendly staff; small, but very clean rooms; breakfast sufficient (with very good coffee :)) - really good value for money, I'll certainly stay there again when I return to Rome (which I certainly will). Absolutely recommendable!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally convenient location”
Reviews.Author: oxforddoc
Reviews.Content: Price very reasonable. Room small and completely renovated. No street noise or inside noises. Three minutes to Roma Termini RR Station. Clean, comfortable bed and climate control. Wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel near termini and plenty of restaurants nearby”
Reviews.Author: Timetraveller13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at Easter and thought was great value for money. It is only a couple of minutes walk to the Termini and if you get the Terravision coach from the airport you just cross the road, walk up the side street & it's on the second street on the right. We had an early morning flight so arrived at hotel about 11am well before check in! The guy at reception was very friendly and phoned cleaner to check room was ready which it was. Room was basic but clean. Had a ceiling fan which was needed as although it rained most of the tine it was warm. We only went for breakfast once as I'm not much of a breakfast person but it was fine. Termini area isn't the nicest of areas but we didn't have any issues and there are loads of restaurants around. We ate in the one next to the hotel which was good, very cheap. Also ate in Mama Angela's which was nearby and that also nice. Overall I was a but disappointed in Italian food but have heard many folk say that. If you want to be near Termini then would recommend this hotel. Its clean, Staff very helpfull & friendly and we even got a chocolate egg for Easter.

Reviews.Title: “Non ce due senza tre”
Reviews.Author: Mariana_Campos
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the hotel. Like last year, the staff was very friendly and the rooms were nice and clean. I already have booked my stay for next year.

Reviews.Title: “A good , comfortable, value hotel close to the termini”
Reviews.Author: SouthOztraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights (10th-14th May) in room 229.Real nice staff, clean and comfortable rooms, the beds were a bit hard for our liking, but that is a personal thing. Good breakfast and excellently located. It represented good value for us. We like walking so we walked to all the major attractions in a day ( not for everyone). We had a room at the front, but quiet and we found the area safe. Our disappointment was how dirty Rome was to the point of disgusting, it is the dirtiest city we have seen

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: snowone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and adequate size for our stay (3 of us) and fresh linens were provided daily. Nice breakfast every morning. Great location near Termini (block and a half) and two nice little side restaurants right outside the hotel which we chose to eat at for lunch and/or dinner. Little shops right outside Termini for cheap souvenirs/postcards. Small supermarket inside Termini to buy bottled water. We used Termini station for metro and also to take the train to the port for our cruise. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If we ever visit again Rome we will definately stay in Assisi!”
Reviews.Author: Xipi7
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very willing to help as and give as advice and instructions about our tour there.Breakfast was really tasty.The room was spacious and confortable.It would be better if it had a cooler.The neighborhood was good not noisy and the hotel about 5 minutes by foot from Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: btex
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May 2011. Location was great and most sites were within 20 minutes walk although we did take Metro to the Vatican but walked back. Only problem we had was finding the Hotel. It is actually quite close to the Terminus and only 2 or 3 minutes walk from the Terravision bus stop. Rooms were clean and tidy, towels changed daily and ample breakfast with fresh coffee on demand.Staff were friendly and helpful and would have no hesitation in staying there again .

Reviews.Title: “good value good location”
Reviews.Author: hagen1947
Reviews.Content: The reviews were accurate. The hotel is in a good location close to railway station and Rome bus station and a lot of attractions in good walking distance. On the morning of a metro strike ( told about that by the staff before we left the hotel ) we walked to the vatican and were not exhausted by such a walk, not as exhausted as we were the following day queuing and being jostled for two hours to get into St peter's foot ball crowds behave better. The staff were perhaps a little over protective waring us about pickpockets on the buses. The room was fine. We were on the street side and light sleepers but no problems. Clean towels every day. We felt save walking the streets at night. The breakfast was fine for us. We could leave our bags as we had alate flight. So we would say we got good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Wetherbees
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Assisi Hotel over Easter 2011. The rooms were clean, cozy, and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful, even giving the kids a special treat on Easter. The hotel is located close to Termini station, which made it easy to get around Rome. The hotel was also very reasonably priced for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff , good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lena131165
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel because of its location(really close to the termini). when we first arrived, we were given a warm welcome and a great espresso!!! both the room and the bathroom were clean, but not very big.we had fresh towels every day...and we could borrow umbrellas at the reception. the only disadvantage is that there was nothing special about the breakfast and the croissants and other pastries were really cold.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zheter
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, welcoming staff, clean room, comparable prices. If I come to Rome again, I'll more likely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Deniseellul
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel having a good position near Termini station.Rooms and common areas were very clean. Good breakfast. Staff was very friendly and helpful. A good place to stay when in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy”
Reviews.Author: Squareman
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in the beginning of November, it isn't a luxury hotel but the double room had an adequate size as was the the bathroom. The room and the bathroom were always cleaned. The breakfast was alright, with cofee , tea, capuccino, cakes, bread, ham and cheese, etc etc etc. The hotel is neighbour of the termini station, a fantastic location. The employees are very friendly and always willing to help. For the price it's a best buy, i recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel with a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Pedro F
Reviews.Content: I stayed on this hotel 4 nights and the only reason I chose this specific hotel was its proximity with Termini Station because I expected to use the metro and the train quite often. Overall the hotel was OK. The single room was a bit too small but very clean, as was the bathroom. There was a TV with lots of channels, but only one in English: BBC News. The air conditioned worked very well and kept the room fresh on an extremely hot week in Rome. The gentlemen on the reception was very helpful, always giving good recommendations on where to eat, what to see and how to avoid most of the tourist scams in the city. The neighborhood was quiet with some restaurants around but nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the moderate price range”
Reviews.Author: MyGreenFunds
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights at the Hotel Assisi and my mother stayed on another 4 nights. I was pleasantly surprised by the offerings of this hotel and think it is a great choice for people who don't want to/cannot pay a lot for a hotel room yet want a clean, central and nice place to stay in Rome. We were given a room on the 4th floor which made it "relatively" quiet in a very busy neighborhood. Our room was comfortable and clean and I was surprised to find the "extras" included in the room such as a sewing kit, shower cap, magnified make up mirror, and hair dryer (albeit a very old model). The people at the front desk were very helpful with giving advice about what tour/sightseeing options were better than others and what would be better for my 80yr old mother to do on her own after I left. The front desk also gave us ice for drinks in the evening which was nice. Breakfast was good with a range of cheese, meats, cereals, yogurt, sweets, and breads. The person on front desk duty will make you an expresso, cappucino, etc and there is a coffee machine if you want extra (not great coffee there but it has hot water so you can switch to tea). The hotel is only a couple blocks from the Termini train station so getting to the airport is a breeze. The hotel Assisi is a good choice for people looking for a reasonably priced, decent, central hotel and I thank the staff for helping to make our stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an okay part of town, and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: USCTrojansFan23
Reviews.Content: Overall, Rome is expensive. Expect to pay a lot and not to receive a lot for your money. This hotel is super convenient because it is very close to the Roma Termini train station, but it a decent hike to any of the big sights (i.e. Vatican City, the Colosseum, etc.). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, convenient, absolutely no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: SamanaFan
Reviews.Content: Quick walk from Termini train station, which means easy access to all trains including metro. Room air conditioned and comfortable bed. Good shower. Great breakfast in the morning - nothing fancy, but if you're like me and happy with a freshly made coffee of your choice, sugary pastry, and some yogourt and fruit to balance it out, you'll be set. Very friendly desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Train station and metro convenience; clean and good buy for Rome”
Reviews.Author: USA_professor
Reviews.Content: Train station convenience, clean and quiet. Very friendly woman at desk provides all sorts of tourist site tips. Easy access to metro. VERY walkable to train station. Small bath, but clean and useable, if a bit cramped. Reasonable prices. Food nearby not the greatest. Small elevator. Air conditioning. TV. Reasonable Internet access can be purchased on first floor. Limited breakfast was adequate. A great choice for a base if you are using the train and you do not intend to spend much time in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and a wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: MusicalMamaUSA
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite jet-lagged and were so happy to settle in to a quiet airconditioned room. Stefania and her staff made our short stay so enjoyable and went out of their way to make us comfortable. Offers of cappucinos and all kinds of advice for tours and restaurants helped us find our way around this incredible city. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: JeanNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Assisi for one night on route home from Sorrento. Hotel was close to termini station. Very clean, excellent service, friendly helpful staff. Good continental breakfast. Our room was very large with a double and two singles even though there were only two of us in the room. Tv, fridge and Air Con. The bathroom had a large shower, hairdryer and complimentary toiletries and slippers. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “While on "Behold Your Mother" pilgrimage”
Reviews.Author: SusanM5
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Loved the small, cozy room, the large shutters, and everything about, especially being right across the street from St. Chiara Piazza!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel near Termini with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: mayantravel
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day sightseeing trip to Rome. The hotel Assisi is down a short side street near the Termini station where the airport buses arrive from, where the bus station is and the only place where both underground lines meet. So it is easy to start or finish the day on public transport The hotel is on 3 floors with a small 2 person lift to take you up to your room - we were on the 4th floor and there were a lot of stairs. The rooms are small but have everything you need, although you may have to hunt for the socket to charge your phone etc. Bathrooms have toiletries and hairdriers (these are unique in my experience but work) and the showers work well. The rooms were very well heated - at times too hot! Breakfast was a choice of a couple of cereals, croissants and bread, fruit, yogurt, ham, cheese and fruit juice. Coffee or tea was freshly made for you. The staff were always helpful and mainly spoke english - the man when we checked in didn't but we managed between us. There are a number of restaurants in the close vicinity and the food in these was better than in the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonBanana
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Rome with 2 friends. We were in Rome for 4 days. The hotel was easy to find and 200 m away from Termini train station. If you are taking the Leonardo Express from the main Rome airport, the walk from platform at Termini to the main station area takes about 15 minutes (fast walking). When we got to the hotel, we were greeted by the friendly reception staff. The hotel is very cute, tidy and homely. The lifts are tiny (2 people only), but we didn't use them choosing to use the stairs to burn off the enormous amount of foods we ate during our stay! The restaurant next door to the hotel is great. I am not sure whether it was because we were so hungry, or whether it was because we were excited to be in Rome (or a combination of both), but the food was amazing! Of course, not Michelin star, just down to earth real italian food. The tiramisu was amazing. The rooms were very tidy and clean. The bathroom was immaculate. We had a TV in the room and wardrobe and a desk. When the hairdryer in the bathroom broke, they gladly gave us a replacement. The buffet breakfast in the morning was great. The croissants were the best bit. Of course there is the standard cornflakes, yoghurt, fruit and a variety of wafers, crackers and biscuits. A real continental breakfast. There is coffee from a machine or the reception staff can make an expresso for you. The staff were very helpful with our queries on what buses to catch and what metro line to use to visit various monuments and sites around Rome. They also gave us a large easy to use map of Rome, which we used a lot! A wee bit of a downside was that my friend could not use her laptop while we were there. The hotel charges for using the wifi internet. The biggest tip which I can give and which I got from another person's Tripadvisor post about their trip to Rome is this: Get the Roma Pass. You can get it from any tourist related place either at the airport or at Termini. We got outs from the Termini tourist desk (again, very helpful and friendly). It gives you unlimited transport for 3 days and free entry into 2 sites anywhere in Rome. We used it for the most expensive sites we visited, which not only saved us quiet a bit, but also a lot of queuing for tickets etc!!! Of course nothing beats walking Rome's beautiful streets, but after a day of walking and full of food, a quick ride home on the Metro or the bus is bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ET-001
Reviews.Content: I was there for my 30th birthday with my family. Service was great. The owner who is also the manager is always to advise and meet customers demand. Room size is big and very clean. Location is also great. The main train station Tarmani is few minutes’ walk. Several restaurants and shops can be found nearby.

Reviews.Title: “I Truly Felt I Was Experiencing Rome”
Reviews.Author: wisperwood
Reviews.Content: This is my second review on accommodations. My recent trip to Rome November 1st thru the 6th was a prelude to boarding a cruise. I found Assisi on this website and the reviews determined my decision n to stay there. I had a budget to work with as I was taking an extended vacation and this was the first leg of it. I would highly recommend this place for anyone in a similar situation. It was a great surprise to find that the old charm and convenient location of Assisi was complimented by the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the room. The outside of the building may throw you off at first, and the neighborhood may leave you wondering if you have picked the right place to stay, but for the money, it was an excellent choice. The rooms have been modernized greatly from the architecture of the building and the décor of the lobby. It had the charm I was hoping for in a stay at an older hotel in Rome. The only thing that I would wish different was the shower stall, it was very small and even though I am a very slim guy, if you moved around in the stall you could hit the knob and turn off the shower. If you are in Rome, are on a budget, want to be near the train station this is a great place for you to stay. They have a continental breakfast in the morning, and although they keep your room key while you are out of the building, it did not present a problem getting into and out of your room. The older caged elevator and worn marble steps of stairway added a romantic charm to the whole appeal of the experience. One other thing to add, there was a pharmacy on the ground floor of the building, which came in handy when I had a headache and aspirin on my journey.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, central location, good rate and relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sagittarianrealm
Reviews.Content: With only a 72-hour stay in Rome we wanted a hotel that was close to the main transport hub for our sightseeing. Hotel Assisi is a small 2-star hotel just a few minutes from Termini- a run of the mill, but generally okay area, to our eyes. We had a 20 euro 3-day Roma Pass and chose the Colosseum and Capitoline Museum for our 2 free sites. Luckily ,we experienced just a five minute queue at the Vatican. December is a great time to visit Rome, apart from the sometimes not so good weather. Regarding the hotel itself, we had a comfortable, pleasant , tranquil , double room with tiled floor, flat screen t.v., mini-bar cum fridge (not stocked), desk, chair and firm double bed . Shower room- not as modern , had strange looking white towels which resembled very large table napkins. Complementary shampoo sachets, soap and shower caps were also provided. There was a small lift (occasionally rather temperamental). For us, the weakest link was definitely the buffet breakfast. Yoghurt one day, none the following day; never any fruit - fresh or otherwise; stale brioches from previous days and if the first few guests had cheese there was no more for anybody else. Alas, all very different from the pictures portrayed on the hotel's websites. And despite this, we feel that we got excellent value and service generally. We paid 162 euro for 3 nights, a saving of 33 euro on either Booking.com or Venere.com, thanks to a previous TripAdvisor post who recommended booking directly with the hotel website. The staff were unfailingly courteous and there was an endearing old-world charm to the place, which we liked very much. Also on our last day they kindly allowed us leave our luggage until evening time. Overall, our stay at Hotel Assisi was a very positive one. As for Rome- well it charmed us to bits.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Lamb55
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights in august. The hotel staff where wonderful very frendly and helpful. Wearrived at 9.30am after a 10hour flight and got our room straight a way. Beakfast was really good and they even had tea! Very close to the train station and the tour buses. Room are aircondition and very quiet. Only problem the shower was very small.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be sorry if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel006
Reviews.Content: This is the side of the train station you should stay on. The other side is run down with graffati and some shady people. The hotel was great. No complaints at all and the little cafe next door had pretty decent pizza. Lots of restaurants nearby and so close to the train station it's an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Assisi in Rome is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Italian-Adventure07
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in Rome. Good value and convenient location within easy walking distance from the train station (Termini) - about 2 min walk. Safe neighbourhood and not a bad walking distance to major sights (if you enjoy walking which we do - otherwise catching buses is easy as most leave from the Termini. Hotel is about a 20 min walk to Colloseum and Roman Forum). Hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included and was sufficient. Room was spacious, clean and charming. Noise from street was a little loud but no worse than is to be expected in a city, and double pane windows allow you to shut noise out. Would reccomend this hotel to travellers looking for good value, helpful staff and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Best hidden secret in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: wanderer_scotland
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were in Rome recently and we stayed in this hotel! We arrived late on the Monday night, and they were ready for us, then we went down to Bari for a few days, and upon our return they were more than ready! 1 minutes walk from the train station and metro, clean rooms, good breakfast in the morning and staff are out of this world! Location at night is a little downfall (not in the greatest street when in the dark), but there is ALOT more good things than badthings!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: SuZeeDee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for exploring Rome. Just a couple of minutes walk from the Termini, where Leonardo Express from the airport arrives. We walked from the Termini to the hotel on our first night, no bother! The hotel is only 2 or 3*, so it's not the Ritz, but for what we paid, it was really good. Expecially considering the cost of hotels in Rome. All we were looking for was a decent place, in a good location at a reasonable cost. The Hotel Assissi is all of these! [We booked directly with the hotel website - that was the cheapest we could get it, and believe me we tried plenty of websites!] The rooms are basic, but a good size, the breakfast is continental but it's all you need to get you started for the day. And the place was very clean. I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to friends. I agree with a previous reviewer - it is a gem of a find. Make sure you have dinner in the restaurant 2 up on the right as you come out of the hotel. Really reasonably priced and possibly the best food we had during the whole of our stay in Italy! The carbonara is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ste7e
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for a hotel 2 mins walk from the main train station , plus the terravision coach from ciampino airport stops at the train station too. my wife and I booked last minuet and this was one of the only hotels with vacancies for the 3 nights we wanted, so we thought we would just book it as it would only be a place to sleep. However the place was great, the recpetion staff was really friendly and allowed us to check in at 10:30am instead of the stated 2pm. the double room we had was large and extremely clean. The hotel its self was very quiet so sleeping was no problem. There are great bars and restaurants literally a stones throw away which are much cheaper than the ones in the centre near the sites. Highly recomend the bar directly oposite and the wine bar on the next street. The assisi is a great place to stay would go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Assisi Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Dei Mille 29, 00185 Rome, Italy
